subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Digest Number 525
msgSnippet: A Midwest/Dallas American accent: 1 HOR[rid] ( hawh -rid - see Gr.2 & Gr.4) adore, store, boar, floor, pour, porch, afford, borne, porter, oral, flora, glory,
messageBody:
A Midwest/Dallas American accent:

1

HOR[rid] ("hawh"-rid - see Gr.2 & Gr.4)

adore, store, boar, floor, pour, porch, afford, borne, porter,
oral, flora, glory, laborious, pictorial, uproarious,  deplore, more, coarse, court, 
(and sometimes "horrid")

mural, curious, Europe, pure, fury, purity ("Y-OU")

boor, poor, tour, endure, lure, gourmet, boorish, tourism, ("OO/OU/OOH")


2

aught, naughty, ought, taut, applaud, autumn, hawk, jaw, chalk, 

(similar, but followed by "r" - see Gr.4)
(horrid) origin, borrow, sorrow, laurel, quarrel, 

Nazi, enchilada, Nevada, profit, honest, MA[hal], AC[cost]

all, bald, calm, balm, psalm, AU[stralia], solve, alter, fault, halt, [Ma]HAL, AL[mond,]

long, off, soft, often, gone, moth, bra, ma, pa,

father, stop, rob, Tom,  Brahms, Taj, knowledge, [marijuan]A, ah, Bach, salaam, spa, sonata, bravado, drama, [pano]RAMA

wash, swan, waffle, lava, plaza, iguana, incommunicado, llama, [mari]JUAN[a], 

florid, moral, [ko]RAN, 

RA[tion]ALE, PA[norama]

KO[ran], [pan]O[rama], (KO[re]O) ("uh")


3

beer, here, pier, fear, appear, [mu]SE[um],

KO[rea], (see Gr.2)

care, air, fair, bear, wear, heir, their, scarce, vary, rarity, dairy, fairy 

fierce, weird, beard, serious, dreary,

idea, real, idea, [ko]REA


4

hurt, church, curb, work, worst, turn, burnt, shirt, firm, twerp, verb, 
term, certain, earth, heard, rehearsal, journal, attorney

far, star, bazaar, sharp, part, harsh, garb, large, farm, Charles, party, heart,
(horrid, origin, borrow, sorrow, laurel, quarrel)



On 7. Nov.,`07, at 03:26 EST, Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com wrote:

just put the groups of words together that rhyme.

L.W. Brown
LwBrown@...

A Midwest/Dallas American accent:

1

HOR[rid] ("hawh"-rid - see Gr.2 & Gr.4)

adore, store, boar, floor, pour, porch, afford, borne, porter,
oral, flora, glory, laborious, pictorial, uproarious,  deplore, more,  
coarse, court,
(and sometimes "horrid")

mural, curious, Europe, pure, fury, purity ("Y-OU")

boor, poor, tour, endure, lure, gourmet, boorish, tourism, ("OO/OU/OOH")


2

aught, naughty, ought, taut, applaud, autumn, hawk, jaw, chalk,

(similar, but followed by "r" - see Gr.4)
(horrid) origin, borrow, sorrow, laurel, quarrel,

Nazi, enchilada, Nevada, profit, honest, MA[hal], AC[cost]

all, bald, calm, balm, psalm, AU[stralia], solve, alter, fault, halt,  
[Ma]HAL, AL[mond,]

long, off, soft, often, gone, moth, bra, ma, pa,

father, stop, rob, Tom,  Brahms, Taj, knowledge, [marijuan]A, ah,  
Bach, salaam, spa, sonata, bravado, drama, [pano]RAMA

wash, swan, waffle, lava, plaza, iguana, incommunicado, llama,  
[mari]JUAN[a],

florid, moral, [ko]RAN,

RA[tion]ALE, PA[norama]

KO[ran], [pan]O[rama], (KO[re]O) ("uh")


3

beer, here, pier, fear, appear, [mu]SE[um],

KO[rea], (see Gr.2)

care, air, fair, bear, wear, heir, their, scarce, vary, rarity, dairy,  
fairy

fierce, weird, beard, serious, dreary,

idea, real, idea, [ko]REA


4

hurt, church, curb, work, worst, turn, burnt, shirt, firm, twerp, verb,
term, certain, earth, heard, rehearsal, journal, attorney

far, star, bazaar, sharp, part, harsh, garb, large, farm, Charles,  
party, heart,
(horrid, origin, borrow, sorrow, laurel, quarrel)



On 7. Nov.,`07, at 03:26 EST, Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com wrote:

> just put the groups of words together that rhyme.

L.W. Brown
